t: Proverbs 4
A Father’s Wise Instruction
Hear,*pn O sons, a father’s instruction, and*ld be attentive, that you may gain insight,
for*ln I give you good precepts; do*ld not forsake my teaching.
When*ln I was a son with my father, tender,*ld the only one in the sight of my mother,
he*ln taught me and said to me, “Let*ln your heart hold fast my words; keep*ld my commandments, and live.
Get*ln wisdom; get insight; do*ld not forget, and do not turn away from the words of my mouth.
Do*ln not forsake her, and she will keep you; love*ld her, and she will guard you.
The*ln beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom, and*ld whatever you get, get insight.
Prize*ln her highly, and she will exalt you; she*ld will honor you if you embrace her.
She*ln will place on your head a graceful garland; she*ld will bestow on you a beautiful crown.”
Hear,*pn my son, and accept my words, that*ld the years of your life may be many.
I*ln have taught you the way of wisdom; I*ld have led you in the paths of uprightness.
When*ln you walk, your step will not be hampered, and*ld if you run, you will not stumble.
Keep*ln hold of instruction; do not let go; guard*ld her, for she is your life.
Do*ln not enter the path of the wicked, and*ld do not walk in the way of the evil.
Avoid*ln it; do not go on it; turn*ld away from it and pass on.
For*ln they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong; they*ld are robbed of sleep unless they have made someone stumble.
For*ln they eat the bread of wickedness and*ld drink the wine of violence.
But*ln the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, which*ld shines brighter and brighter until full day.
The*ln way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they*ld do not know over what they stumble.
My*pn son, be attentive to my words; incline*ld your ear to my sayings.
Let*ln them not escape from your sight; keep*ld them within your heart.
For*ln they are life to those who find them, and*ld healing to all their flesh.
Keep*ln your heart with all vigilance, for*ld from it flow the springs of life.
Put*ln away from you crooked speech, and*ld put devious talk far from you.
Let*ln your eyes look directly forward, and*ld your gaze be straight before you.
Ponder*ln the path of your feet; then*ld all your ways will be sure.
Do*ln not swerve to the right or to the left; turn*ld your foot away from evil.
